templates.name: What does CertiPUR-US® certified mean?
templates.content:
When we say that DreamCloud's foams are CertiPUR-US® Certified, we mean that these foams meet the rigorous CertiPUR-US® standards for emissions, content, performance, and durability. This seal means that DreamCloud foams are:

• Made without ozone depleters
• Made without PBDEs, TDCPP or TCEP ("Tris") flame retardants
• Made without mercury, lead and heavy metals
• Made without formaldehyde
• Made without phthalates regulated by the Consumer Product Safety Commission
• Low VOC (Volatile Organic Compound) emissions for indoor air quality (less than 0.5 parts per million)

templates.name: What is a hybrid mattress?
templates.content:
A hybrid mattress is one that combines the support of a traditional box spring mattress combined with high density foams that offer supreme comfort. For many people, a hybrid mattress is the ideal choice for a mattress since it's considered to be the "best of all worlds." 

Hybrid mattresses allow sleepers to enjoy the sturdy support of coils and the contouring comfort of foam for a restful night's sleep. With DreamCloud's plush hand tufted Cashmere cover, high density foams, heat-treated cotton pad to make sure you sleep cool, and patent-pending encased coils to provide the ultimate support, it means that you won't just go to sleep, you'll end up Dreaming on a Cloud.

templates.name: Which mattress is better for back aches and soreness?
templates.content:
If you experience back aches and soreness, you need a mattress with a medium-firm feel, so it needs to be not too soft and not too firm.

While both the DreamCloud and DreamCloud Premier offer a medium-firm rating of 6.5, sleepers that regularly experience back aches or soreness are better suited to the DreamCloud because its tighter top offers the right combination of give and firmness.

The DreamCloud is so soothing for back aches and soreness, it's even won the "2020 Best Mattress for Back Pain" award from Tuck.

templates.name: How do I take care of my DreamCloud mattress?
templates.content:
The best way to care for your DreamCloud mattress is to ensure its placed on a firm, solid surface (like a bed base), that's structurally capable of supporting the weight of your mattress plus its sleepers. Aside from that, you can also care for your mattress by:

• Changing your bedding once a week to reduce dead skin cells, oils and sweat from coming into contact with your mattress.
• Rotating your DreamCloud every three months to encourage even wear across the mattress surface. (No need to flip it though!)
• Cleaning dust particles off of your mattress by vacuuming it once a month.
• Installing a mattress pad or protector to protect your DreamCloud from spills and other accidental damages.

templates.name: Tell me more about your Memory Foam mattresses
templates.content: What's great about our Memory Foam mattresses is their versatility, they're well-suited for all types of sleepers. The key to good support is proper spine alignment, and that's where our Memory Foam really shines. It contours to your body, providing personalized support that aligns with your spine. And with a durable foam base layer, you're getting a solid foundation. So, when you choose our Memory Foam mattress, you're not sacrificing support at all. You're getting a mattress that adapts to your body, ensuring comfort and proper alignment, no matter how you sleep.
